metadata.title: CVE-2021-3478 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a flaw in OpenEXR's scanline input file functionality in versionsbefore 3.0.0-beta. An attacker able to submit a crafted file to beprocessed by OpenEXR could consume excessive system memory. The greatestimpact of this flaw is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3478` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr24 - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5
openexr - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5').
